intro: Calyptranthes pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It has simple, alternate leaves that are usually oval or elliptical in shape. Calyptranthes pauciflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
